unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals are the REAL Deal
normalised: lights, camera, festival! why film festivals are the real deal

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Tired of the same old popcorn flicks at your local PVR? Wanna dive deeper into the world of cinema, beyond the usual masala entertainment? Then you gotta explore the world of film festivals, ya'll!
normalised: hey bollywood buffs and cinephiles! tired of the same old popcorn flicks at your local P V R? wanna dive deeper into the world of cinema, beyond the usual masala entertainment? then you gotta explore the world of film festivals, ya'll!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a giant, delicious buffet of movies. From award-winning indie dramas to quirky documentaries and cutting-edge experimental films, they’ve got it all. Forget the 3 hours of 'Pathaan' (okay, maybe don't *completely* forget), but consider trying something different!
normalised: think of film festivals as a giant, delicious buffet of movies. from award-winning indie dramas to quirky documentaries and cutting-edge experimental films, they’ve got it all. forget the three hours of 'Pathaan' (okay, maybe don't completely forget), but consider trying something different!

unnormalised: India has some amazing film festivals! The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is a classic. I remember hearing stories from my cousin, Priya, who volunteered there back in 2015. She said it was crazy, filled with red carpets, film screenings, and parties that lasted till 3 AM. She even saw Shah Rukh Khan!

unnormalised: But it's not just about the glamour. Film festivals are a fantastic place to discover new talent and perspectives. They offer a platform for filmmakers from all over the world, including those from small towns and villages in India, who might not otherwise have a chance to showcase their work. Think about it - you could be witnessing the next Satyajit Ray!

unnormalised: Besides IFFI, there are tons of other festivals like the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI), the Kolkata International Film Festival, and even smaller, more niche festivals focusing on specific genres or regions. Just do a quick Google search for film festivals near you! Some even have online options now.

unnormalised: Attending a film festival doesn’t have to break the bank either. Many offer student discounts, and some screenings are even free! Plus, the people-watching is top-notch. You'll meet fellow film nerds, directors, actors, and critics – all passionate about the art of storytelling.

unnormalised: So, ditch the predictable Netflix scroll for a weekend, and embrace the magic of film festivals. You might just discover your new favorite filmmaker or find a movie that changes your life. Trust me, it's an experience you won't regret. Maybe I'll see you at IFFI Goa next year?
